questions.education: Sets are collections of distinct elements. In mathematics, sets are often denoted by curly braces {}. When working with sets, it is important to understand operations such as union, intersection, and difference.
questions.question: What is the result of the union of two sets A and B?

options.a: The set of all elements that are in A or B, or both
options.b: The set of all elements that are in both A and B
options.c: The set of all elements that are only in A but not in B
options.d: The set of all elements that are in A and not in B

questions.education: When working with sets, the intersection operation results in a new set that contains only the elements that are common to both sets. This operation is denoted by the symbol ∩.
questions.question: What is the result of the intersection of two sets A and B?

options.a: The set of all elements that are in A or B, or both
options.b: The set of all elements that are in both A and B
options.c: The set of all elements that are only in A but not in B
options.d: The set of all elements that are in A and not in B
